job.title: Software Engineer - Entry Level
job.description: ltstronggtjob detailsltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtnew ideas are all around us but only a few will change the world thats our focus at jpl we ask the biggest questions then search the universe for answersliterally we build upon ideas that have guided generations then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come your missionyour opportunityis to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer if youre driven to discover create and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond youre ready for jplltbrgtltbrgtlocated in pasadena california jpl has a campuslike environment situated on acres in the foothills of the san gabriel mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other we inspire passion foster innovation build collaboration and reward excellenceltbrgtltbrgtltstronggtltugtresponsibilitiesltbrgtltbrgtltugtltstronggtour missions are complex longlasting farreachingand each one is unique were constantly developing new missionspecific software for designers engineers architects and developers who like to test the limits jpl is a constant source of new stimulating challengesltbrgtltbrgtin this role you would be a vital team member in a jpl software or computer engineering groups you will partner with lead engineers to design code and develop secure software applications and interface solutions that power jpls spacecraft science instruments mission control systems science analysis pipelines and it services you will integrate algorithms and models into software components for production and analysis of mission and enterprise data you will use general understanding of the complexity and interdependence involved with integrating multiple applications with complex data sources and deploying the resulting systems at sites worldwide and beyondltbrgtltbrgtopportunities in software computing systems engineering include but are not limited to the followingltbrgtltulgtltligtcybersecurity engineerltligtltligtdata scientistltligtltligtdata visualization developerltligtltligtelectrical ground support equipment software engineerltligtltligtengineering applications software engineerltligtltligtflight software engineerltligtltligtscientific application ampamp data interaction engineerltligtltligtscientific applications software engineerltligtltligtsoftware systems architectltligtltligtsoftware systems engineerltligtltligtsoftware systems engineerltligtltligtuser interface designerltligtltligtuser interface developerltbrgtltligtltulgtltstronggtltugtqualificationsltbrgtltugtltstronggtltulgtltligtbachelors with at least one year related work experience masters or phd degree in computer science computer engineering software engineering or a related majorsltligtltligtminimum of a cumulative gpaltligtltligtrecently completed coursework providing an understanding and application of standard principles theories concepts and techniques in software or relatedltligtltligtgeneral knowledge of applicable industry andor academic practices and standards in related to software or relatedltligtltligtstrong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environmentltligtltligtprior internshipvolunteer experience in related disciplinesltligtltligtparticipation in studentvolunteer organizationsltligtltligtstrong analytical skillsltbrgtltligtltulgtjpl is an equal opportunity employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex race color religion national origin citizenship ancestry age marital status physical or mental disability medical condition genetic information pregnancy or perceived pregnancy gender gender identity gender expression sexual orientation protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by federal state or local lawltbrgtltbrgtin addition jpl is a vevraa federal contractorltbrgtltbrgteeo is the lawltbrgtltbrgteeo is the law supplementltbrgtltbrgtpay transparency nondiscrimination provisionltbrgtltbrgtthe jet propulsion laboratory is a federal facility
